name: silver-metal
desc_full:
As the title mentioned, this is the most popular version. It features a single speaker,
has a metal shell and a 5000mAh battery.

This tuner is somewhat easy to update - the BOOT button is hidden behind the headphone jack.
It runs on PE5PVB's firmware.
Also available in a slightly different case with silver buttons, although the build quality varies on the seller. Some have been reported to have glued screens instead of having them secured using screws..
cons: Rather ugly stickers, can be peeled off though

name: deepelec
desc: Brand new version with a numeric keypad by DeepElec.
desc_full: A very unique model with a numeric keypad. The board seems to be built really well and the price is very competitive. Users seem to be very satisfied with this model so far.
cons: A metal case would fit the model better

name: silver-mini
desc: One of the most premium versions on the market.
desc_full:
This version features one high-quality speaker,
has a metal shell and a 2.4 inch touchscreen.

This tuner is quite small, but has very good build quality and comes with a custom case, although it comes at a rather premium price.
It runs on PE5PVB's firmware.
cons: The price is higher, but understandable

name: palm-powerhouse
desc_full:
This version features one high-quality speaker,
has a metal shell and a 2.4 inch touchscreen, same as the silver mini version.

This tuner is the samllest one available on the market, though reportedly it has good build & sound quality.
It runs on PE5PVB's firmware.
cons: The price is higher, but understandable

name: blue-2-speakers
desc: One of the more expensive tuners, contains an LNA switch.
desc_full:
This receiver is probably one of the most expensive ones you can buy. It features a case that could hold 2 speakers, but only one is mounted,
an LNA switch and has a 5000mAh battery. The outer shell is made of PCB plastic.

This tuner is also easy to update as you don't need to press any BOOT buttons inside.
pros: Has LNA (suitable for telescopic antenna DX)

name: qodosen
desc: A receiver similar to XHDATA/Sangean models.
desc_full:
Premium price, yet non-premium case, as it's made from plastic. It's ideal for people who want to DX with a portable receiver, as the handling is comfortable.

This tuner runs on proprietary firmware and therefore is suitable only for portable DXing.

name: e-ink
desc: An unique approach to a portable receiver.
desc_full:
Definitely one of the cheaper ones, although not as popular. The battery capacity is sadly unknown. The outer shell is made of plastic.

This tuner runs on proprietary firmware and therefore is suitable only for portable DXing.
Fairly ideal for MW and countries on FM where RDS isn't used.

name: silver-vertical
desc: A receiver similar to XHDATA/Sangean models.
desc_full:
This is a vertical model. If features a single speaker, a metal shelf a build in telescopic antenna and a 3000mAh battery.

The tuner is easy to update, the BOOT button is available at a small hole on the side of the housing. It runs on PE5PVB's firmware.
cons: Battery is glued inside, can become loose

name: desktop
desc_full:
This receiver is the only one on this list that is suited for home use and also includes an IR remote.

It runs on PE5PVB's firmware, but some models reportedly don't have an USB port,
so updating might be more difficult.
cons: Having an USB port is a gamble
The single built-in speaker is quiet

name: gray-plastic
desc: A very compact version with plastic casing
desc_full:
Quite a cheap version though, however I would generally recommend to stay away from plastic portables due to QRM issues, which were already reported with this model.

It runs on PE5PVB's firmware.
Updating is quite difficult due to a different display driver + a 12MHz crystal (these need to be set manually when flashing).

name: blue-plastic
desc_full:
This receiver uses PE5PVB's firmware, but that's where the pros end.
The outer shell is made of very cheap plastic and users have reported that the build quality is bad.

The speaker is also very quiet and the entire board is has interference issues. Try to avoid this one.
pros: Easy to rebuild into a custom case

name: tef86
desc_full:
This receiver uses PE5PVB's firmware, but a very outdated version.
The boot button is sadly very difficult to access, as you have to short it yourself.

Many people have reported various build quality issues even up to fake TEF6686 chips.
Try to avoid this one.

name: rg178
desc: Replacement pigtail for portable TEF receivers.
desc_full:
Replacement pigtail. It's recommended to replace it if you have issues catching even strong local stations.

Recommended sizes:
Silver TEF: SMA F2H to IPEX 15cm
Blue TEF: SMA F to IPEX 15cm

name: 75cm_antenna
desc: A replacement antenna for portable TEFs.
desc_full: Replacement antenna. It's recommended to replace it if your old one is broken, or just as a spare one.

name: 955565_battery
desc: A replacement battery for portable TEFs.
desc_full: Replacement battery. It's recommended to replace it if your old one is broken, or just as a spare one. Compatible with most models.

name: replacement-screws
desc: Replacement screws for portable TEF receivers.
desc_full: Size M2 5mm is recommended for the silver portable models.
pros: Big pack - you will never run out

name: portable-case
desc: Replacement screws for portable TEF receivers.
desc_full: Size M2 5mm is recommended for the silver portable models.
pros: Big pack - you will never run out
